I had no issues playing this at all. For the record I use Linux Mint 12 and SMPlayer. Again it played back A-OK without any issues or glitches.

Quality is excellent!

Thank you for the upload!

Follow Up To What I Wrote Above:

Tried it in VLC (Linux version) and it works fine. I played it from about 35 minutes through to the 40 minute mark. It played without any glitches.

I then remuxed the MKV to a M2TS using the Linux version of tsMuxeR and it created the M2TS without errors. I've found that when there is an error in the video stream that tsMuxeR will error out during this process and yet here it did not.

I file seems to be 100% A-OK

I really hate losers who rag on perfectly good files !!!

Again thank you for the upload!

I wanted to make a follow up to my statement above.

I ran the MKV through VLC (the linux version) and it played A-OK. I played it from approximately the 35 minute mark to just past the 40 minute mark. It was smooth as butter with no glitches.

Also I ran it through the linux version of tsMuxeR. I used to use this program for making M2TS files when I used a PS3 as a media server (the M2TS file format is native to the PS3). I found that if there were any glitches in the video file that the M2TS remuxing would error out. It created the M2TS without any issues. I then played that file in VLC from roughly 35 minutes to 40 minutes and once more it played fine.

The file seems to be 100% A-OK.

I really hate it when people bitch about perfectly good files. Thanks again for the upload!
The English subs go out of sync about 3/4 the way through using vlc.

This release worked fine for me in VLC 2.0.1 on Windows 7. No audio/video/sync glitches at all what I could see.
@voltaire64: There are no subs in this torrent. If you downloaded it from another place it might be that it's not for the REPACK-version, but instead for the other glitch version that makes the subs out of sync.

Thanks for another great upload
A.10

No sound here when I tried to play it on my blu-ray player. A real shame :(

F**king AVS, doesn't know how to encode a file?! The audio is in STEREO!! Not in 5.1 channels as in all IMMERSE releases! >:(
Moreover, the audio is with Header Stripping, which makes it unable to be played in most Home Cinema players (Blu-Rays, HD TVs, etc.) and some PC media players too.
All IMMERSE releases had 5.1 audio and NO Header Stripping.
Please, IMMERSE, do all the ripping from now on! Or teach AVS how to do a proper encoding.

Thanks for your guide @Thor-csf! Since we don't have a better file out there, I used your instructions and am finally able to watch it on my home TV set.

AVS, thanks for the upload! But on the next ones, please use the 5.1 audio, and absolutely NO stripped audio headers!

V:9
